metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7869 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
GnuTLS before 2017-02-20 has an out-of-bounds write caused by an integer overflow and heap-based buffer overflow related to the cdk_pkt_read function in opencdk/read-packet.c. This issue (which is a subset of the vendor's GNUTLS-SA-2017-3 report) is fixed in 3.5.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

gnutls-bin - 2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8').
gnutls26 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-12ubuntu2.8').
gnutls28: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
